instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15” Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: 3332 stops booting
threads.message:
I have a 3332 board that starts to boot normal but 10-20 seconds in it seems to semi-crash... not reboot but the screen goes black and external display (if any) quits. Still shows USB activity. I'm wondering if this is a GPU issue of some sort. I do get less than 1V on L3895 whether it looks to be booting or not. Also once it crashes or stops booting it doesn't seem to be able to stay running on battery power. If I let it sit for a while, it will boot off the battery initially or stay running with battery plugged in. After I've tried booting a couple of times it no longer shows backlight, display or any external display unless I let it sit for a while again.

Basically at first boot, it appears everything is working temporarily but the display functions go away and ability to run off battery as well. I had switched the battery thinking it was bad, but then realized 2nd battery (I let it fully charge - light was orange for over hour or so and went green) it still has same problem

threads.title: 3332 stops booting
threads.message:
You should try known good battery, to discard it as issue.

Resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> first, as basic step for 3332 board.

threads.title: 3332 stops booting
threads.message: Well heyyyyyyy... after resoldering <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> it actually seems to stay on. Does appear 2nd battery is junk as well. I have one on the way. As always, thanks for your help!

threads.title: 3332 stops booting
threads.message:
I said resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>; not really needed to change it.
Leaded solder usually fixes the problem.

threads.title: 3332 stops booting
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 67449, member: 682"]
I said resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>; not really needed to change it.
Leaded solder usually fixes the problem.
[/QUOTE]
Indeed. That’s what I did and it worked!
